meanings.definition: A cavity in the body of certain invertebrates through which blood circulates.
meanings.sent1: The hemocoels in insects allow blood to flow freely throughout their bodies.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the hemocoels in invertebrates to understand their circulatory systems.
meanings.sent3: The curious ant accidentally wandered into the hemocoels of the beetle, mistaking it for a tunnel.
meanings.sent4: The hemocoels of the earthworm are like tiny rivers carrying essential nutrients.
meanings.sent5: As the microscope zoomed in, the intricate network of hemocoels became visible.

meanings.definition: The body cavity of certain invertebrates that contains hemolymph.
meanings.sent1: Hemolymph flows through the hemocoels of arthropods, providing nutrients and oxygen.
meanings.sent2: The hemocoels of crustaceans are filled with hemolymph, similar to blood in vertebrates.
meanings.sent3: The spider decided to host a dance party in its hemocoels, inviting all its arthropod friends.
meanings.sent4: The hemocoels of the centipede were like bustling highways for the hemolymph traffic.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the pulsating movement of hemolymph in the hemocoels was mesmerizing.
